item.title: Working with sparse matrices in C++
item.description: Working with sparse matrices is a big part of my day. Social networks are inherently sparse, so sparse matrices are the best buds you can get when representing large networks as adjacency matrices.1 As so, I usually find myself trying to take advantage of their structure as, contrasting dense matrices, we donâ€™t need to write nested for(i...) for (j...) loops to work with them, instead, sometimes all what we want is just to extract/work with its non-zero elements.

item.title: Setting up optional OpenMP support with RcppArmadillo
item.description: Setting up an R package that supports OpenMP can be a bit awkward. While systems like Ubuntu with g++ have straight forward support for -fopenmp flags, the same may not be true un MacOS’s clang, since the latter is not shipped with it. In order to solve this, it is necesary to have different src/Makevars file depending on whether the compiler supports OpenMP or not. This can be solved using a configure file, more over, autoconf.
